results.title: Bonnie and Clyde (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Warren Beatty, Warner Bros Pictures and Arthur Penn
results.brief_description: Alternating between comedy and tragedy this violent and kinetic re-telling of the story of Bonnie and Clyde is justifiably one of the most celebrated American films of the sixties. Set in the early thirties of the Depression, a car thief and his girl-friend commit a series of robberies which earn them a reputation as America’s most feared criminals. Featuring superb production values and brilliant editing, Arthur Penn’s film is an ironic exploration of the romantic roots of the counter-culture in the myths and memories of the Depression and within Hollywood depictions of the “outlaw”. The film’s controversial use of violence is simultaneously brutal and liberating. With Warren Beatty, Faye Dunaway and Gene Hackman.

results.title: BMX Bandits
results.creator_credit: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Paul F. Davis, Tom Broadbridge and Nilsen Premiere
results.brief_description: Action filled fun entertainment, BMX Bandits stars a very young Nicole Kidman, David Argue and John Ley.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Paul F. Davis, Tom Broadbridge and Nilsen Premiere
results.description: PJ, Goose and Judy are three teenagers saving to buy BMX bikes. In their efforts, they stumble across a case of smuggled walkie-talkies needed by a bunch of crooks for their next job. Accidentally, while testing them, the teenagers alert the police on the same airwave band. The rest of the film becomes a BMX packed chase as the crooks and the police seek the trio. Action filled fun entertainment, “BMX bandits” stars a very young Nicole Kidman, David Argue and John Ley.

results.title: Blue steel
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Bigelow, Oliver Stone, Edward Pressman and Lightening Pictures
results.brief_description: A steadily paced thriller from director Kathryn Bigelow starring Jamie Lee Curtis as Megan Turner, a recently graduated New York cop who is stalked by the same murdering mad man that she is investigating. An outcast in her family and in constant difficulty when it comes to relationships as a result of her occupation, suffering chastisement even within the career path she has devoted herself to, the start of a new passionate romance with Eugene Hunt (Ron Silver) has all the appearance of a turn around in her fortunes. However, little is as it seems and with the help of a fellow officer she is forced to confront her obsessive nemesis and her own self-doubts and fears. This film is a suspenseful and psychological drama with an unexpected and insightful angle on the nature of human needs and desires and the complexities of human relationships in the contemporary and ever anonymous city. Kathryn Bigelow develops a dream-like perspective on the characters and turn of events in the film, an early example of her fluid style of direction.

results.title: Blue in the face
results.creator_credit: Paul Auster, Wayne Wang, Diana Phillips, Peter Newman, Greg Johnson and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Director Wayne Wang and screenwriter Paul Auster team up again for the follow up movie from “Smoke”. This film once again centres on the Brooklyn corner Cigar Store and manager Auggie Wren (Harvey Keitel), although most of the other characters are different. Plotlines follow Auggie’s frustrated wife, Dot (Roseanne), and her attempts to seduce her husband. Also included are appearances by Jim Jarmusch, who shows up as a man about to smoke his last cigarette, and Lily Tomlin as a man with chest hair, obsessed with acquiring a Belgian waffle. Cast also includes Madonna, Michael J. Fox, Lou Reed (as himself) and Mira Sorvino.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Auster, Wayne Wang, Diana Phillips, Peter Newman, Greg Johnson and Miramax Films

results.title: Blowup
results.creator_credit: Michelangelo Antonioni, Carlo Ponti, Premier Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Inspired by a short story by Julio Cortazar, Antonioni uses the narrative structure of the detective story and employs spatial depth and appearance to question the viewer’s sense of what is real and what is not. Set against a backdrop of London, the film follows young fashion photographer Thomas (David Hemmings) as he snaps his way through the world of 1960s British counterculture. While wandering through a park one day, he photographs two lovers, only to discover while printing and enlarging the images in his darkroom, that he may have inadvertently photographed a murder. Cast includes Vanessa Redgrave, Sarah Miles, John Castle and Jane Birkin. Music by Herbert Hancock. Cinematography by Carlo di Palma.

results.title: Bloodlust
results.creator_credit: Jon Hewitt, Richard Wolstencroft and Windhover Productions
results.brief_description: The most controversial and acclaimed cult hit since “Mad Max.” Banned in seven countries including Britain, “Bloodlust” is the tale of three modern day vampires on a bullet-riddled rollercoaster to hell. Winner Finalist Award “Best Film” Worldfest Housten, Texas. Starring John Stuart Wallace, Kelly Chapman, Robert James O’Neill and Phil Motherwell. Music by Revolting Cocks, Pailhead, Lead into Gold and 100 Homo DJ’s.

results.title: Blood: the last vampire
results.creator_credit: Production IG, Yukio Nagasaki, Ryuji Mitsumoto and Hiroyuki Kitakubo
results.brief_description: It is 1966, and the Vietnam War has just erupted. After a spate of suicides at the military school on the grounds of the U.S controlled Yokota Air Force Base in Japan are attributed to chiropterans, demons who live off human blood, a top secret organisation orders the mysterious and brooding Saya to hunt down and destroy the vile creatures responsible. Armed with a special samurai sword, Saya infiltrates the school in the guise of a new student, and launches a covert investigation, which soon leads her to the source of the problem. However, one of the chiropterans manages to escape, and Saya suddenly has her hands full when the school nurse is captured. It soon becomes a race against time to slay the demons before they take over the Base and kill all the humans within in it. Based on the manga of the same name, this fast-paced film is essentially a section of a much larger story, and is the first fully digital anime ever created. Instead of cels, the film used a computer system that created frames digitally from scanned artwork, using a computer to paint each frame. Director Hiroyuki Katakubo originally started off as an animator, before getting his first gig as a director on the hentai series, Cream Lemon. He has now established himself among the top anime directors, directing films such as ‘Roujin-Z’ (1991) and contributing to an episode of ‘Robot Carnival’ (1987). This video also features a documentary detailing the making of the ‘Blood: the last vampire’.

results.title: Blinky Bill (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: Blinky Bill the koala sets off to try and find his mother after their peaceful bush home is destroyed by loggers. He meets new friends and has many adventures along the way in this delightful animated film which is based on Dorothy Wall’s classic story.

results.title: Blackrock
results.creator_credit: Steven Vidler, David Elfick, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: The badly beaten, gang-raped corpse of a 15 year old girl is discovered on a deserted stretch of beach after an all-night beach party, celebrating the return of local surfing legend, Ricko, goes out of control. The working class Australian coastal community of Blackrock goes into an uproar, and is promptly splintered by shame, deceit and mistrust. 17 year old Jared (who organised Ricko’s party at the local surf club), is left with the wrenching decision whether or not to rat on his mates. Cast includes Laurence Breuls, Linda Cropper, Simon Lyndon, Chris Haywood, Rebecca Smart, Essie Davis and Jessica Napier.
